thread.title: The Latest: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals
thread.title_full: The Latest: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals

author: wtopstaff
title: The Latest: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals
text:
Home » News » Sports » MLB » The Latest: Volquez to… The Latest: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals By The Associated Press October 26, 2015 2:35 pm Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Edinson Volquez delivers to the Toronto Blue Jays during the fifth inning in Game 5 of baseball's American League Championship Series in Toronto, Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT 
The latest on the World Series, which opens Tuesday night with the Kansas City Royals hosting the New York Mets (all times local): 
1:30 p.m. 
Edinson Volquez will start the World Series opener for Kansas City, followed by Johnny Cueto in Game 2. 
Royals players said Monday that Yordano Ventura will start Game 3 at Citi Field on Friday, followed by Chris Young in Game 4. 
New York’s rotation opens with Matt Harvey, and Jacob deGrom, Noah Syndergaard and Steven Matz follow. Topics:
